Articles.Content:
Hello ladies and gents, I have been stalking the forum for a while trying to take in all the details of my new habit. After spending about five hours on a rocket with lander looking into space and dreaming of a dual station vista for epic screenshots; I realised I'm gonna be here for a long time. So I thought I would do things properly

I'm Mr Morphine, an avid gamer of 38 - I know 2 years off 40! ... maybe I should get out a bit more ... that poor guy floating around Ike though? ... hmmm

Lots of games on my playing list but this certainly topped them in a big way. I always loved space, science and sci fi. Being a 3D animator and artist I hope to start creating some interesting ideas and sharing them with you guys. There are already some great inspiring mods and a fine community.

Is there a Kerbal space program anonymous? or a pill?

Edited November 20, 2013 by Morphine04
cant speel
No. Here we encourage you to FEED the addiction. "Better to be on KSP than crack", I say.

I'm Mr Morphine, an avid gamer of 38 - I know 2 years off 40! ... maybe I should get out a bit more ...

I'm turning 42 in a bit over a month...

And you aren't our oldest member Jim

Welcome to the community Morphine04, and have fun.

And you aren't our oldest member Jim

Welcome to the community Morphine04, and have fun.

Need an over-40 club and also a senior citizens subforum... =)

Definitely one of the awesome parts of this game is, that all ages can play it, and all ages can enjoy it, as long as you have an interest in space/space exploration, and that is something very special nowadays. One of the other amazing parts is the community, which is a one in a million type. You can't really find a single troll or general ass-hat around here, as all seem to respect each other. And this is the first time on the internet, where I have experienced that people value my opinion just as much as theirs, even though I'm only 16. This forum is so fantastic, also because people tend to do something out of their grammar, and what they write, whether they are 50 or 13. That's a genuinely rare thing today, especially on the internet, so welcome to your new home my fellow Kerbal, better wrap yourself in a blanket and secure the seat-belt, because you are in for a long ride.
I think I take my interest in space a little overboard. My friends think that very much so.
Your not a true KSP-er until you have met the Kraken

I think I take my interest in space a little overboard. My friends think that very much so.

I'm not alone it seems...

I think I take my interest in space a little overboard. My friends think that very much so.

So a guy walks into a bar and the bartender asks him "What can I get for ya?', so the guy says "Yeah I'd like something to get me high.", the bartender looks at him and says "Sorry sir we don't have any drugs here", and then the guy says "Drugs, what are you talking about? I just want to reach my Apoapsis! Give me a shot of DeltaV!" ba-dum-tss!

To be honest I think that's like the first time I've ever even attempted to make a joke.. I believe I failed..? Maybe not. Probably. *facepalm* Welcome to the forums Morphine.
I have come face to face with the Space Kraken. And I saw my own soul...
Patch up the hole and get back into space. Welcome!
